pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

#### Declarations diff

üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.

:v: madvorak can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11164790194/job/31034960475)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11164790194/job/31034959874)

Thanks!
maintainer merge

bors d+

Thanks!

Thanks!
maintainer merge

bors d+

Thanks!
While you're here, can you convert this instance to use `where` so that the `}` can be dropped?
And please remove the porting note on L70, because that seems to have been done.

Or even
```suggestion
  coe_injective' x y h := by
```

```suggestion
  coe c := c.r
```
sorry I'm late for this, but does it work?
It would and `coe := (¬∑.r)` would work as well.

Should I create a new PR to change it?
FYI `coe := fun` is present 22 times throughout Mathlib, so your proposal could be applied en masse.

I personally like the `(¬∑.r)` syntax, but I have a feeling that this is not a mainstream opinion.  I think that moving identifiers to the left of `:=` is welcome, though, so that would probably be uncontroversial as a change (assuming that those are already in `where` form).
I can do your version (moving `c` to the left). That said, this is a proposal for a new PR. Do you want me to apply the change to every `coe` in Mathlib?
I would say yes, although unless we try to seriously enforce it, it will relapse.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - style(GroupTheory,RingTheory/Congruence/Basic): use `where`, fix whitespace
